intro: Alyssum alyssoides var. hispanicum, commonly known as Spanish alyssum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
